That's great to hear that meal prep has been working well for you! It's amazing how having a plan and preparing healthy foods in advance can make such a big difference in our daily lives. Quinoa, brown rice, roasted veggies, and grilled chicken or salmon are all excellent choices - you're definitely on the right track!

Regarding yoga and digestion, yes, there are several benefits! Yoga can help improve digestion, reduce symptoms of IBS (irritable bowel syndrome), and even alleviate constipation. The physical postures, breathing techniques, and meditation in yoga can:

1. **Increase blood flow and oxygenation**: Yoga helps improve circulation, which can aid in digestion and reduce inflammation in the digestive tract.
2. **Stimulate digestive enzymes**: Certain yoga postures, like twists and forward bends, can stimulate the digestive enzymes and improve digestion.
3. **Reduce stress and anxiety**: Yoga's relaxation response can help calm the nervous system, which can reduce stress and anxiety that can exacerbate digestive issues.
4. **Improve gut motility**: Yoga can help regulate bowel movements and improve gut motility, reducing symptoms of constipation.

It's fantastic that you've noticed an improvement in your digestive system and overall well-being since starting your yoga practice! Keep up the great work, and enjoy your Sunday morning yoga classes!

Remember, everyone's body is different, so it's essential to listen to your body and adjust your diet and exercise routine accordingly. If you have any specific questions or concerns, feel free to ask!
